Authors: Karolina Fučíková, Jared C. Rada, Louise A. Lewis
Title:
Polyphyly of the genus Dictyococcus (Chlorophyceae,
Chlorophyta) and a proposal for Bracteacoccus schumacherensis.
Abstract:
In coccoid green algae, sole use of the limited morphology
for taxonomy and systematics can lead to taxonomic and systematic
confusion. Using other forms of data, several green coccoid genera have
been shown to be non-monophyletic in the past. Using phylogenetic
analysis of rbcL and 18S rDNA sequence data, this study demonstrates
that Dictyococcus schumacherensis Metting is related to species in the
genus Bracteacoccus Tereg. This placement is consistent with the species
ecology and vegetative morphology. Consequently, we propose a new
combination, Bracteacoccus schumacherensis (based on Dictyococcus
schumacherensis), and emend the species description with an altered
interpretation of chloroplast features. The genus Dictyococcus, based on
its type species, D. varians Gerneck, remains a distinct taxon, but its
exact placement in Chlorophyceae remains unresolved by 18S and rbcL
data. The previously expected sister relationship of Dictyococcus with
Bracteacoccus is not supported by this study.
